net.bubbaland.megaciv.game

Class Civilization

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.bubbaland.megaciv.game.Civilization
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Civilization>

    public class Civilization
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Civilization>
    Class for specifying the data object for a single civilization.
    Author:
    Walter Kolczynski
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Civilization.Age
      Enumeration of ages along the AST track.
      static class  Civilization.AstChange
      Enumeration of possible results for an AST change.
      static class  Civilization.AstRequirements
      A data object for holding AST requirements for a given Age.
      static class  Civilization.Name
      The names of the 18 allowed civilizations.
      static class  Civilization.Region
      Enumeration of possible regions.
      static class  Civilization.SortDirection
      Enumeration of directions for sorting a list of civilizations.
      static class  Civilization.SortOption
      Enumeration of allowed ways to sort a list of civilizations.

      Constructor and Description
      Civilization(Civilization.Name name, Game.Difficulty difficulty)
      The primary constructor for creating a civilization.

      • Civilization

        public Civilization(Civilization.Name name,
                    Game.Difficulty difficulty)
        The primary constructor for creating a civilization. Values are initialized to their start-of-game values.
        Parameters:
        name - The civilization name.
        difficulty - The current difficulty of the game.

      • astRequirementString

        public java.lang.String astRequirementString(Civilization.Age age)
        Create a string listing all of the AST requirements for the given age, color-coded by whether the civiliztion currently meets each requirement. Requirements in green are currently satisfied; requirements in red are currently not satisfied.
        Parameters:
        age - The specified Age.
        Returns:
        A string representation of the given age's requirements.

      • clone

        public Civilization clone()
        Get a copy of this Civilization object. This is used to create a copy of Civilization data while editing to allow for reversion to the previous state.
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A deep copy of this Civilization.

      • getTypeCredit

        public int getTypeCredit(Technology.Type type)
        Get the number of credits towards the specified advance Type. This includes credits from all purchased advances, including additional credits chosen for Monument and Written Record.
        Parameters:
        type - The specified type.
        Returns:
        The number of credits for the specified type.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • sortByVP

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Civilization> sortByVP(java.util.ArrayList<Civilization> civs,
                                                         Civilization.SortDirection direction)
        Sort a list of civilizations based on the number of victory points. Ties are broken based on AST.
        Parameters:
        civs - List of civilizations to be sorted.
        direction - The desired sort direction.
        Returns:
        A sorted list of civilizations.

      • sortByCities

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Civilization> sortByCities(java.util.ArrayList<Civilization> civs,
                                                             Civilization.SortDirection direction)
        Sort a list of civilizations based on the number of cities. Ties are broken based on AST rank. This sort is used for handing out trade cards.
        Parameters:
        civs - List of civilizations to be sorted.
        direction - The desired sort direction.
        Returns:
        A sorted list of civilizations.

      • sortByMovement

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Civilization> sortByMovement(java.util.ArrayList<Civilization> civs,
                                                               Civilization.SortDirection direction)
        Sort a list of civilizations based on the movement order. This is usually census order, but may be modified by the advance Military.
        Parameters:
        civs - List of civilizations to be sorted.
        direction - The desired sort direction.
        Returns:
        A sorted list of civilizations.
